description: This report isolates coordinated group fraud networks most likely to be actioned on by HHS — multi-member networks with corroborating signal types, significant estimated overpayment (>$500K), and evidence not dominated by COVID-era billing patterns. Modeled on the Feeding Our Future prosecution: shell entities registered in bursts, synchronized billing ramps, phantom servicing relationships, and recycled beneficiary pools.

members.case_narrative: SPECIAL TOUCH HOME CARE SERVICES, INC. (NPI: 1447393319) is a Medicaid-enrolled organization provider based in NY with $745,668,883.76 in total billing. In their peak month (2019-11-01 00:00:00), this organization billed 72,780 claims with 1 servicing providers, implying 413.5 claims per worker per hour — a physically impossible volume. This provider is part of a cluster of 43 organizations registered in the same quarter (unknown) with identical taxonomy (251E00000X) in NY, with combined billing of $4,963,650,603.51 — a pattern consistent with coordinated shell entity registration. This provider derives 94.7% of all claims from a single procedure code (T1019), billing 3,946,811 claims of this one code out of 4,169,477 total — a concentration pattern associated with fraud schemes built around a single high-reimbursement service. This provider receives $230.30 per claim for HCPCS code 99199, which is 43.2x the national median of $5.33 — indicating modifier abuse, place-of-service fraud, or billing rate manipulation. Estimated total overpayment: $745,668,883.76. Composite risk score: 100/100 (critical risk).
